title: X has no counter-play
body: Can we stop abusing that line please? It's actually irritating to read now, especially because people just throw it around to emphasize how much they dislike a champ, rather than using it when a champ ACTUALLY has little counter-play.

Poppy is 10 times healthier than her old iteration. She's actually allowed to have a *niche* now...and she's allowed to be *good at things* now.

alright poppy had a niche, it was a small one, but it was there. new poppy is not "niche" its silly and can be played into any matchup with or against any team comp. and poppy's win conditions are simple. bully the lane, farm your ass off. snowball like a truck into skirmishes and then win the game. yea you can do cool stuff with her ult. but its usually press r if winning hold r if losing

Old Poppy: Was so cancerous that Riot left her almost unplayable for years.

New Poppy: Designed to be relatively strong early on offense so she can get gold, then fall back into a warden play pattern during later stages of the game with her "return to base" ult, knock-back on E, dash-countering W, and slow on Q you can put down to slow advancing enemies. 

Given Poppy's fall back pattern during mid/late game, Poppy's highly unlikely to carry games by herself, but she makes a strong asset to that end if she has a few competent team mates. Sure, Poppy was a bit too strong before, but she's perfectly fine when balanced well, so why throw a fit?

Fiora's rework is maybe healthy?

Look, just answer this question then. How do you counterbuild Fiora?

I'm no expert, but I imagine you'd build armor and HP, just like you would against Vayne. Is it as effective as it is against, say, other champions? No, but that's by design and can be tuned as necessary.

Except Fiora has massively more % HP true damage than Vayne, that also scales with AD, and comes in burstier amounts.

You can't outrun, out tank, out heal, or out damage a Fiora.
*cough crowd control cough burst cough kiting cough playing around your vitals cough not trying to be a frontliner when playing adc cough cough*

CC? Her W.

Burst? Out dranktanked/her W.

Kiting? Don't make me laugh, her Q.

Playing around vitals? Oh no so hard, only gains movement speed for hitting them and can be reset by walking in and out of range.

Frontline? What Fiora who knows a damn about the game would frontline? You wait for cooldowns to be down and then go in.

All these things you mention are what makes her strong at 1v1s, which is what she is; a duelist. In team fights if the other team has 2 or more cc spells to use on you, your w isn't gonna save you. Her heal is only achieved by hitting vitals, which you **can play around**, and she only gets the movement speed when she hits vitals, which is what you want to try to stop her from hitting. Also, if you kite her q before it hits you, it has a relatively long cool down. She has counterplay, but you need to outplay her.

... out-tank, out-heal? 

What are you even on, man? She is not a tank nor is she a healer. Just from this short little interaction I can tell you're pretty much as biased as the "DELETE LEE SIN" crowd, so I'm just going to leave it at that. I feel like even if someone did tell you how do something against Fiora, it wouldn't matter to you because it would somehow just reinforce your opinion.

First of all, what I mean by out tank is build tank states in attempt to beat her 1v1, aka what the tanks do. This doesn't work.

Out heal? To put it simple, she heals too much. She's not even made to be a "draintank" and does more drain tanking than Aatrox once mid game begins.

Actually I think Lee Sin just needs a small base MS nerf, 10 more seconds of cooldown added to his ult at all ranks, and then maybe reduce his lifesteal/spellvamp but that would depend of how hard the former are as nerfs. Why delete him? He's a fantastic idea of "the playmaker" style character that really makes people want to play the game. He's hard to play, but it feels very rewarding.

If I'm bias then prove it. Heck, you could also try to disprove my logic. Seriously, just try to. How do you counterbuild Fiora effectively? If you can't put up, then don't get up in the first place.

You know what? No, I'm not biting the bait on this one. I'm looking at this and if these are your justifications for "out-tank" and "out-heal" then my time is better spent elsewhere. 

Before I go: to out-tank does _NOT_ mean simply 1v1s. She is not a tank. Period. Full stop. Throw her into a teamfight and she will outright not live as long as a tank unless she built tank, but if she built tank then her damage isn't scary anymore. Tanks aren't known for their 1v1 prowess.

Out-heal: She has 1 way to receive mass healing, and that's to trigger her ult. For this the person who has received her ult has to die (preferably with 2-3 vitals popped) or she has to pop all 4 vitals--popping all 4 vitals on a target that isn't a potato and letting you do it is not easy, meaning she has to work for it. Aatrox on the other hand? He just hits you 3 times. Ever. They don't even have to be consecutive hits like Vayne, he just hits 3 times.

You're biased. You're blatantly biased. You're biased to the extent that this is the most time I'm going to afford you.

Your disrespectfulness meets no bounds. You fail to prove anything and dare act like some almightly lord? Shame to you.

God I wish I had an emote to describe how wrong this is. Let me put it simply.

{{champion:114}} Free sustain, gapclosing, tank busting passive based on RNG. {{champion:114}} Q with little to no cooldown or mana cost. {{champion:114}} W that negates opponents building offensively against her or from using CC on her. {{champion:114}} Nearly oneshots anyone, including tanks, using her Ultimate. {{champion:114}} Also gives a giant AoE heal. {{champion:114}} Has no feasible way to be counter-built. {{champion:114}}
This is opposed to the Fiora of before that went 0/11/2 and was completely useless or went 20/0/4 and you couldn't stop her.

Fiora pre-rework was a gapclosing monster that had an ult that could take just about anything down to half health alone  if she wasn't too far behind, with no counterplay if the target didn't have Zhonya. Old Fiora was MUCH harder to play against, and therefore, my point is still valid. Fiora isn't even innately that overpowered, she's just overtuned right now. Frozen Heart, Randuin's, Executioner's Calling and Ninja Tabi delay her damage output and healing, and she pops like a balloon when locked down. Just don't throw all your team's CC into her riposte at once, and you should be fine.

Fiora and Sion's VGU's are failures in balance.

Fiora, I shouldn't need to explain. Percent health true damage that scales with AD, and also her W effectively disabling her opponent.

Sion just lacks reliability, hence he's really outclassed.

sion doesn't lack reliability as much as he is the only champion that truly tests the skill of his user.

you can't outrun a sion q easily if the user is good enough.

his e with proper mana managment is terrifying.

and his shield makes him a nightmare to duel so long as he knows how to time it right.

plus his ult when the user is skilled is not as limiting as it may seem.

I would say that sion is a near perfect example of what a champ in this game should look like when someone says that the champ needs high skill. not free low cooldown dashes or three hit passives. but abilities that are actually hard to hit at all when the person using the champion doesn't know the ins and outs of what the champion does.

They have to stand behind Ryze's next 3.
